question: When are you the most productive?
ans: In the morning, for sure.
At night, most definitely.
When dusk falls, before it’s completely dark out.
At the crack of dawn.

question: What is your favorite type of food?
ans: Sweet. What’s a little sugar between friends?
Salty. I just can’t get enough!
Sour. The more lip-puckering, the better!
Spicy. I don’t want to feel my lips when I’m done!

question: What is your dream job?
ans: A job where I can protect others, like a firefighter.
A job where I have a lot of power and control, like a politician.
A job where I can have fun, like a safari guide.
A job where I can help others, like a doctor.

question: What are your friends like?
ans: They’re high-energy—I feel like I’m their parent half the time.
They’re all on the introverted side.
They’re pretty independent, but we make time for each other.
They’re really loyal.

question: How do you feel on a daily basis?
ans: Happy and loved.
Anxious and uncertain.
Bored and restless.
Determined and strong.

question: If you had a superpower, what would it be?
ans: The ability to grow infinite arms. I’d get so much done!
The ability to speak every language. I’d be able to help everyone.
The ability to fly. That would make things interesting!
The ability to turn back time. I could fix everything wrong with the world.

question: How do you see your life?
ans: I see it as a boat, journeying courageously into uncharted waters.
I see it as a train, chugging along to a set destination.
I see it as a path, well-traveled by those who came before me.
I see it as a tree: determined, vibrant, and unyielding.

question: Which color best represents you?
ans: Yellow or orange.
Black or blue.
Purple or pink.
Red or gold.

question: What’s your favorite thing about the sky?
ans: The Sun. It’s so warm and nurturing!
The Moon. It’s always changing, but it never leaves the sky.
The stars. I love to watch them come out each night.
The sunrise. All the colors are so beautiful!

question: Your friend is having a tough time. How do you support them?
ans: I give them a shoulder to cry on.
I play a game with them to take their mind off things.
I send them an encouraging text.
I show up at their home with their favorite snack.
